headline.print_headline: Half of Rise in Fire Risk Is Tied to Climate Shift
headline.main: Climate Change Blamed for Half of Increased Forest Fire Danger

snippet: A study found that human-caused warming was responsible for 55 percent of the rise in the dryness of the landscape in the western United States....
abstract: Scientists, in study published in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, assert that since 1979, climate change is to blame for more than half of dryness of Western forests and longer fire season; total forest fire area has increased by 16,000 acres since 1984, with forest fires in Western states burning longer and with more intensity.
